meanings.definition: Affected by or exhibiting prejudice or hostility.
meanings.sent1: She gave a jaundiced look to anyone who disagreed with her.
meanings.sent2: His jaundiced view of the world made it hard for him to trust others.
meanings.sent3: The jaundiced cat refused to play with the new kitten.
meanings.sent4: Despite his jaundiced opinions, he found a way to appreciate the beauty around him.
meanings.sent5: The jaundiced sky cast a gloomy shadow over the town.

meanings.definition: Having a yellowish or greenish pigmentation in the skin, whites of the eyes, etc., due to liver disease.
meanings.sent1: The doctor noticed the jaundiced hue of the patient's eyes.
meanings.sent2: After the illness, her skin appeared jaundiced for a few weeks.
meanings.sent3: The jaundiced banana looked unappetizing, but still tasted sweet.
meanings.sent4: The jaundiced glow of the streetlights gave the city a surreal appearance.
meanings.sent5: The jaundiced leaves of the tree signaled the arrival of autumn.
